benchmark_details.name: Beyond the Link: Assessing LLMs' ability to Classify Political Content across Global Media
benchmark_details.overview: This study investigates the ability of large language models (LLMs) to classify political content (PC) versus non-political content (non-PC) from URLs and full article texts across five countries, evaluating their performance against human annotations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of LLMs in classifying URLs as political or non-political content and to provide methodological recommendations for researchers in political analysis.

data.source: Web-tracking data and human-coded articles from multiple countries.
data.size: 1,140 visits (200 political and 200 non-political per country)
data.annotation: Manual classification by researchers based on content analysis.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model performance against human-labeled articles.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and AUC indicates better classification performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Human annotations serve as the baseline for model performance.
methodology.validation: 5-fold cross-validation performed on each country's set of labeled documents.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data collection adheres to institutional and national ethical standards and regulations.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants provided informed consent in accordance with EU-GDPR.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The study complies with GDPR and other national requirements.
